organic.title: Scripting API now in public beta!
organic.snippet: The Minecraft Script Engine uses the JavaScript language. Scripts can be written and bundled with Behaviour Packs to listen and respond to game events.

organic.title: A decent add-on API documentation
organic.snippet: I really don't like the basic API docs in a Wiki. If you're serious about this, you document this on a good, developer-oriented, web site.

organic.title: [Modding API] Extensive modding support into the existing ...
organic.snippet: A (promised) Minecraft modding API is a feature that has been extensively requested over the years and is still being requested.

organic.title: Scripting api
organic.snippet: There is a scripting api available for the bedrock edition, in order to make it work you have to adjust a toggle 'use experimental gameplay' in the settings.

organic.title: Metal 3 API for Minecraft Java
organic.snippet: A new API called “MetalFX Upscaling” does the following: “Render complex scenes in less time per frame with high-performance upscaling and anti-aliasing.

organic.title: Questions about Code Builder for Minecraft
organic.snippet: I would like to program with Python for MEE. So, I have a question about the Code Builder for Minecraft: Education Edition API Documentation ...

organic.title: Java Modding API
organic.snippet: If you created a Java API that had the approachability of Fabric, the versatility of Forge, unified all mods to a singular modloader, and was ...

organic.title: [Bedrock Scripting API] Get the display name of an item in ...
organic.snippet: Currently, there is no way to get the translated name of an item via the scripting api. This makes it difficult to include items in scripted messages.

organic.title: API for Python notebooks?
organic.snippet: Where can I find the API for the Minecraft Python notebooks? I'm very excited that we have Python available without the blocks in M:EE.

organic.title: Lua-Based API for Bedrock Addons
organic.snippet: It's clear, it's concise, and it's minimal. Not to mention the fact that the api could be expanded with more features then executing commands.
